column3: `fix-timesmart` appears to fix the issue I experienced with incorrect transaction timestamps when importing watch-only addresses. After compiling, I used `-rescan` as well as `-zapwallettxes`, neither of which resolved the issue (on my end). After making a new wallet and reimporting with `importmulti`, the timestamps are correct.

Unsure on the reasoning behind this initial behaviour so can't ACK/NACK until Luke or someone else explains. But looks like src/wallet/test/wallet_tests.cpp needs updating too. \n\nNote I don't think GitHub doesn't understand "Fixes X and Y" when it does it's auto-close, you probably have to write Fixes X, fixes Y.
The idea IIRC was simply to ensure timestamps move forward at least in ordinary circumstances.

There hasn't been much activity lately and the patch still needs rebase, so I am closing this for now. Please let me know when you want to continue working on this, so the pull request can be re-opened.
